noun.description: A means of raising money by selling numbered tickets, one or some of which are subsequently drawn at random, the holder or holders of such tickets winning a prize.

verb.description: Offer (something) as a prize in a raffle.
examples: a work that will be raffled off for a fine arts scholarship

origin: Late Middle English (in the sense rabble, riffraff): perhaps from Old French ne rifle ne rafle nothing at all.
